8690300Frostbite Produces a Mist of FrostLaunches a mist of frost when struck with frost
8690400Sleep Produces a Mist of SleepCreates sleep-inducing mist when struck with sleep
8700000Poison Increases Attack PowerIncreases attack power when struck with poison
8710000Blood Loss Increases Attack PowerIncreases attack power when struck with blood loss
8720000Sleep Increases Attack PowerIncreases attack power when struck with sleep
8740000Frostbite Increases Attack PowerIncreases attack power when struck with frost
8750000Madness Increases Attack PowerIncreases attack power when struck with madness
8880000Ice Storm upon Charged SlashCharged slash produces ice storm
8880100Ring of Light upon Charged SlashCharged slash produces a ring of light
8880200Black Flames upon Charged SlashCharged slash produces black flames
8880300Phantom Attack upon Charged SlashCharged slash triggers phantom attack
8880400Roaring Flames upon Charged SlashCharged slash produces roaring flames
8881000Holy Shockwave upon Charged StrikeCharged strike produces a golden shockwave
8881100Projectiles upon Charged StrikeCharged strike produces magic projectiles
8881200Luring Enemies upon Charged StrikeCharged strike pulls in enemies
8881300Shockwave upon Charged StrikeCharged strike produces a shockwave
8881400Phantom Attack upon Charged StrikeCharged strike triggers phantom attack
8881500Magma upon Charged StrikeCharged strike produces magma
8881600Magic Bubbles upon Charged StrikeCharged strike produces magic bubbles
8882000Phantom Attack upon Charged ThrustCharged thrust triggers phantom attack
8882100Lightning upon Charged ThrustCharged thrust produces a bolt of lightning
8882200Acid Mist upon Charged ThrustCharged thrust releases acid mist
8882300Pest Threads upon Charged ThrustCharged thrust releases pest threads
8882400Poison Mist upon Charged ThrustCharged thrust releases poison mist
8882500Charged Thrust Invokes Sleep MistCharged thrust releases sleep-inducing mist
8883000Projectiles Launched upon AttacksAttacks create projectiles that inflict follow-up attacks
8883100Lightning upon Precision AimingPrecision-aimed shot produces a bolt of lightning from the point of impact
8883200Poison Mist upon Precision AimingPrecision-aimed shot produces poison mist from the point of impact
8883300Rot Mist upon Precision AimingPrecision-aimed shot produces rot-inducing mist from the point of impact
8883400Bloodflies upon Precision AimingPrecision-aimed shot releases a swarm of bloodflies from the point of impact
8884000Shielding Improves Damage NegationIncreases damage negation for magic, fire, lightning, holy, and ailments by keeping shield held up
8884100Shielding Invokes Indomitable VowBecome invincible for a moment by keeping shield held up
8884200Shielding Creates Holy GroundSlowly restores HP by keeping shield held up and creates a holy ground that enhances damage negation
8884300Broken Stance Activates EndureActivates Endure to boost poise and damage negation when parried and stance is broken
8885000Flask Healing Also Restores FPUsing flask also restores FP
8885100Failing to Cast Sorcery Restores FPFailing in casting sorcery restores FP when FP is insufficient
8885200Guarding Ups Attack & Casting SpeedsContinued guards enhance attack power and casting speed
8920100Improved Non-Physical Attack PowerEnhances attack power of magic, fire, lightning, and holy affinities
8921400Critical Hits Boost Attack PowerCritical hits raise attack power
8960100Changed Strong AttacksStrong attacks change to a different attack
8960200Strong Jump Attacks Create ShockwaveStrong jump attacks produce a shockwave at the landing point
9021400Power of Night and FlameSkill activation adds attack power of magic or fire affinities
9030900Power of Dark MoonAttacks lower enemies' magic damage negation
9031000Power of the Greater WillCharge attacks produce waves of light
9031400Power of the BlasphemousRestores HP upon defeating enemies
9031500Power of House MaraisRaises attack power upon defeating enemies
9031700Power of the Golden OrderCharge attacks heal all ailments and dispel all temporary effects
9040200Power of Destined DeathAttacking also wears down enemy HP for a moment afterwards
9040500Power of the StarscourgeThe first blow of consecutive attacks creates a gravitational wave that pulls in enemies when wielding two swords
9040800Power of DestructionCharge attacks cause a wave of gravitational force
9041000Power of VengeanceEnhances all attributes upon defeating enemies. This effect accumulates.
9060400Power of the DragonlordStrong jump attacks transform the wielder into a thundercloud that plunges down with a lightning-infused blade
9071000Power of DespairAttacked enemies become likely to die regardless of remaining HP
9081000Power of the Omen KingCritical hits produce a burst of flame
9090200Power of the UndefeatedAttacks after receiving damage partially recover HP
9111500Power of the QueenCharge attacks cause a holy shockwave
9122000Power of the BlasphemousRestores HP upon defeating enemies
9130300Power of the Lightless VoidAttacks send forth a dark cloud of stars on rare occasions that lingers briefly before exploding
9150400Power of the Golden LineageCharge attacks cause an earth-shaking shockwave
9151100Power of the Ancestral SpiritAttacks temporarily lower nearby enemies' damage negation on rare occasions
9160900Power of the Great Ancient DragonCharged Skill activation adds attack power of lightning
9170100Power of the Blood LordBlood loss in vicinity increases attack power
9200600Power of the GiantSkill activation calls forth a barrage of flame pillars
9210600Power of the Flying DragonCritical hits make the dragon spew flames
9230500Power of the First LordCharge attacks enhance attack power
9330900Power of Full MoonCasting spells dispel incoming sorceries and incantations, using their power to retaliate with glintblades
9420000Power of the GeneralStrong attack fires off a bundle of arrows
9990100The Wylder's GriefThe Wylder's grief enhances strength and dexterity
9990200The Guardian's GriefThe Guardian's grief enhances maximum HP and stamina
9990300The Ironeye's GriefThe Ironeye's grief enhances maximum stamina and dexterity
9990400The Duchess' GriefThe Duchess' grief enhances dexterity and intelligence
9990500The Raider's GriefThe Raider's grief enhances maximum HP and strength
9990600The Revenant's GriefThe Revenant's grief enhances faith and arcane
9990700The Recluse's GriefThe Recluse's grief enhances maximum FP and intelligence
9990800The Executor's GriefThe Executor's grief enhances dexterity and arcane Goods
100Tarnished's Furled FingerCreates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer. Arrive as a cooperator (Furled Finger) with the objective of defeating the area boss of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.
101Duelist's Furled FingerCreates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer. Arrive as an adversary (Duelist) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. The bronze adornments are the mark of a duelist.
102Bloody FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. Glistening blood has been siphoned into the nail of this finger. Its sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.
103Finger SevererSends another, or oneself, home Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Use as a Host of Fingers to select a summoned player and send them back to their world. Use when you have been summoned to another player's world to return to your own world. This phantom blade severs the link formed by a Furled Finger, but the maidens scorn those who abuse its use.
104White Cipher RingWhen invaded, requests the aid of a hunter Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (Summoning is not always possible.) One of the lost mystic codes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.
105Blue Cipher RingAnswers requests for summoning from hunters Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter. During hunter multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the invader of the summoned world.
106Tarnished's Wizened FingerUsed to write messages to other worlds Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Messages menu.) Use to write messages. Your messages will be conveyed to other worlds, allowing other players to read them. A finger of corpse wax, so emaciated the bone is visible. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.
107Phantom Bloody FingerAttempts repeat invasion of last targeted world Item for online play. Obtained after invading another world. Consumed upon use. Attempts another invasion of the most recently invaded world. This may come in handy should separation from the Host of Fingers force a temporary retreat.
108Taunter's TongueLures in invaders Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion. Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)
109Small Golden EffigySends a co-op sign to summoning pools Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Send a cooperative summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In cooperative multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned.
110Small Red EffigySends a hostile sign to summoning pools Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Send a competitive summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
111Festering Bloody FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Consumed upon use. Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is blackened with blood congestion. It seems to have been chopped off rather unceremoniously.
112Recusant FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Recusant) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is covered in snake scales. An heirloom of the lord of the Volcano Manor, bequeathed to Tarnished who have become family.
113Phantom Bloody FingerAttempts repeat invasion of last targeted world Item for online play. Obtained after invading another world. Consumed upon use. Attempts another invasion of the most recently invaded world. This may come in handy should separation from the Host of Fingers force a temporary retreat.
114Phantom Recusant FingerAttempts repeat invasion of last targeted world Item for online play. Obtained after invading another world. Consumed upon use. Attempts another invasion of the most recently invaded world. This may come in handy should separation from the Host of Fingers force a temporary retreat.
115Memory of GraceLose all runes, return to last site of lost grace visited The memory of first grace, which once guided bygone Tarnished to the Lands Between. Lose all runes and return to last site of grace visited. It is merely a cycle. Stand before the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.
130Spectral Steed WhistleSummon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed. (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon his death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so drains the Flask of Crimson Tears.
135Phantom Great RuneGive blessing of blood to enemies in invaded world Item for online play. Obtained after using the Mohg's Great Rune and invading another world. Consumed upon use. Enemies inside the invaded world receive a blessing of blood, which boosts their attack power when blood loss occurs nearby. Also, your HP recovers when blessed enemies defeat a player.
150Furlcalling Finger RemedyReveals co-op and hostile summoning signs Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
170Tarnished's Furled FingerCreates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer. Arrive as a cooperator (Furled Finger) with the objective of defeating the area boss of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.
171Duelist's Furled FingerCreates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer. Arrive as an adversary (Duelist) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. The bronze adornments are the mark of a duelist.

If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. Glistening blood has been siphoned into the nail of this finger. Its sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.

Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (Summoning is not always possible.) One of the lost mystic codes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.

Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter. During hunter multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the invader of the summoned world.
178Taunter's TongueLures in invaders Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion. Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)
179Small Golden EffigySends a co-op summoning sign to summoning pools Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Send a cooperative summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In cooperative multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned.
180Small Red EffigySends a hostile summoning sign to summoning pools Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Send a competitive summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
181Spectral Steed WhistleSummon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed. (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon his death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so drains the Flask of Crimson Tears.
182Furlcalling Finger RemedyReveals co-op and hostile summoning signs Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
183Festering Bloody FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Consumed upon use. Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is blackened with blood congestion. It seems to have been chopped off rather unceremoniously.
184Recusant FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Recusant) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is covered in snake scales. An heirloom of the lord of the Volcano Manor, bequeathed to Tarnished who have become family.
190Rune ArcGrants the blessing of an equipped Great Rune upon use A shard of the shattered Elden Ring. Grants the blessing of an equipped Great Rune upon use. Even if no Great Rune is equipped, it will slightly increase maximum HP upon use. The lower arc of the Elden Ring is held to be the basin in which its blessings pool. Perhaps this shard originates from that very arc.
191Godrick's Great RuneRaises all attributes A Great Rune of the shardbearer Godrick. Its blessing raises all attributes. This Great Rune is known as the anchor ring, found in the center of the Elden Ring. The first demigods were The Elden Lord Godfrey and his offspring, the golden lineage.
192Radahn's Great RuneRaises maximum HP, FP and stamina A Great Rune of the shardbearer Radahn. Its blessing raises maximum HP, FP and Stamina. Radahn was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika. The Great Rune burns, to resist the encroachment of the scarlet rot.
193Morgott's Great RuneGreatly raises maximum HP A Great Rune of the shardbearer Morgott. Its blessing greatly raises maximum HP. This Great Rune is the anchor ring that houses the base, and proves two things: That the Omen King was born of the golden lineage, and that he was indeed the Lord of Leyndell.
194Rykard's Great RuneRestores HP upon defeating enemies A Great Rune of the shardbearer Rykard. Its blessing restores HP upon defeating enemies. Rykard was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika. But Rykard fed himself to the blasphemous serpent, Great Rune and all.
195Mohg's Great RuneGrants a blessing of blood to phantoms A Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg. Its blessing grants a blessing of blood to summoned phantoms, and imparts a Phantom Great Rune upon successful invasion. Mohg and Morgott are twin brothers, and their Great Runes are naturally similar. But Mohg's rune is soaked in accursed blood, from his devout love for the wretched mire that he was born into far below the earth.
196Malenia's Great RuneAttacks recover HP after damage is taken A Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia. The blessing of this half-rotted rune reduces the healing power of Flask of Crimson Tears. And yet, due to the infusion of Malenia's spirit of resistance, attacks made immediately after receiving damage will partially recover HP. Malenia is daughter to Queen Marika and Radagon, and her Great Rune should have been the most sacred of all.
200Flask of Crimson TearsRestores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
201Flask of Crimson TearsRestores HP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

233Flask of Cerulean Tears +6Restores FP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
234Flask of Cerulean Tears +7Restores FP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
235Flask of Cerulean Tears +7Restores FP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
250Flask of Wondrous PhysickBestows various special effects A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various special effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. Basins are placed at the feet of Minor Erdtrees throughout the Lands Between in order to collect their crystallized tears.
251Flask of Wondrous PhysickBestows various special effects, but is empty now A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various special effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. Basins are placed at the feet of Minor Erdtrees throughout the Lands Between in order to collect their crystallized tears.
300Fire PotThrow at enemies to inflict fire damage A cocktail of incendiary materials sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to inflict fire damage.
301Redmane Fire PotThrow at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Engraved with the crest of red-maned lion. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Even today, the survivors of Radahn's battalion employ fire to stave off the scarlet rot.
302Giantsflame Fire PotUses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Giants' Flame. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Damage scales with faith.
320Lightning PotThrow at enemies to inflict lightning damage A cocktail of fulminating materials sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to inflict lightning damage.
321Ancient Dragonbolt PotThrow at enemies to inflict heavy lightning damage Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Engraved with the crest of the ancient dragon. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy lightning damage. Allows one to wield ancient drake lightning regardless of faith. The residual power of relics is a purely natural phenomenon.
330Fetid PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison A cocktail of effluents sealed inside a pot. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
340Swarm PotThrow to release a swarm of bloodflies A cocktail of effluents sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to set a swarm of bloodflies upon them. The vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss. The cacophony of their wings assails the sanity of berserkers. The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.
350Holy Water PotThrow at enemies to inflict holy damage Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order. Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
351Sacred Order PotUses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
360Freezing PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of frost A pot engraved with the crest of the Carian Royals. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost. Originates from the cold, dark moon of Ranni, the Carian princess.
370Poison PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of poison A cocktail of poisonous materials sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.
380Oil PotThrow at enemies to soak them in oil Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside. Throw at enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
390Alluring PotThrow at enemies to lure human-build foes Pot enchanted with assassin incantations. Throw at enemies to create a pale shadow. The illusion will lure in and distract foes of human frame.
391Beastlure PotThrow at enemies to lure beastly prey Pot enchanted with assassin incantations. Throw at enemies to create a red shadow. The illusion lures in beasts into attacking it.
400Roped Fire PotThrow behind to inflict fire damage Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of incendiary materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict fire damage.
420Roped Lightning PotThrow behind to inflict lightning damage Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of fulminating materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict lightning damage.
430Roped Fetid PotThrow behind to cause buildup of deadly poison Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
440Roped Poison PotThrow behind to cause buildup of poison Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of poison.
450Roped Oil PotThrow behind to douse enemies in oil Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
460Roped Magic PotUses FP. Throw behind to inflict magic damage. Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of magically resonant materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Consumes FP. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict magic damage.
470Roped Fly PotThrow behind to release a swarm of flies Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to release a swarm of flies. Their fangs inflict countless painful lacerations on the victim while the grating sound of their wings assails their sanity. The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.
480Roped Freezing PotThrow behind to cause frostbite build-up Craftable with a cracked pot. Frost has been sealed inside. A short rope that aids throwing is attached. Thrown at rearward enemies using the rope, the pot explodes, causing frostbite buildup in enemies.
490Roped Volcano PotCreates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Powdered volcanic rock is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Thrown at rearward enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.
510Roped Holy Water PotUses FP. Throw behind to inflict holy damage. Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Consumes FP. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
600Volcano PotCreates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage Powdered volcanic rock sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.
610Albinauric PotUses FP. Throw to impede healing using a flask of tears. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by sorceries of the Cuckoos. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to impede recovery actions using a flask of tears for a certain duration. The Knights of the Cuckoos do declare. Behold, thy defiled blood. Unlike any humor that flows in our grand realm.
630Cursed-Blood PotThrow to douse enemy with accursed blood Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Decorated with the crest of the Lord of Blood. Throw at enemies to douse them in accursed blood, causing summoned spirits to assail them with a rabid fervor. A childhood memory of the Lord of Blood.
640Sleep PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of sleep Pot enchanted by the incantations of St. Trina. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of sleep. Like a lullaby, or a quagmire, its light-purple haze irresistibly draws its victims down into sleep. Sweet dreams.
650Rancor PotThrow at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits Pot enchanted by the ancient death hex. Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits that chase down foes. In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.
660Magic PotThrow at enemies to inflict magic damage A cocktail of magically resonant materials sealed inside a pot. Called a "faux sorcery" in Raya Lucaria. Throw at enemies to inflict magic damage.
661Academy Magic PotUses FP. Throw to inflict heavy magic damage. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by Raya Lucaria sorceries. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy magic damage. This pot, considered a "faux sorcery," was employed to protect the academy.
670Rot PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot A pot decorated with the crest of scarlet wings. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot. The rot bubbles up from the Swamp of Aeonia, and eats away at life like a vicious plague.
700Wending GraceRise from defeat a single time An afterglow of lost grace unleashed by the tide of Night. Allows one to rise from defeat a single time. Will take effect when kept in possessions. Lost upon use. The world crumbles. And yet light, forgetful of its own path, still seeks a follower to bestow guidance upon, summoning again grace once lost.
810Rowa RaisinOn horseback, feed to Torrent to restore HP Preparation of dried Rowa fruit. Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to restore his HP. Humans are unable to digest Rowa fruit, but Torrent seems to have a taste for it.
811Sweet RaisinOn horseback, feed to Torrent to greatly restore HP Preparation of dried Golden Rowa fruit. Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to greatly restore his HP. Golden Rowa fruit is not unlike honey, and Torrent seems to have a taste for it.
812Frozen RaisinOn horseback, feed to Torrent to vastly restore HP Preparation of dried Rimed Rowa. Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to vastly restore his HP. Torrent seems to enjoy the sensation of chewing this frozen, dried seed.
820Boiled CrabGreatly boosts physical damage negation for a time Boiled crab meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting. Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration. Unlike the "prawn" sold, this truly is crab. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.
830Boiled PrawnBoosts physical damage negation for a time Boiled prawn meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting. Boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration. The meat actually looks to have come from a crayfish. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.
900Neutralizing BolusesAlleviates poison buildup and cures poison Green boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
910Stanching BolusesAlleviates impending blood loss Red boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates impending blood loss. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Blood loss escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
920Thawfrost BolusesAlleviates buildup of frost Ice-hued boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates buildup of frost and cures frostbite ailment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Frost accumulates gradually, causing damage and inflicting frostbite once the threshold is reached. Vulnerability to damage increases for a certain duration.
930Stimulating BolusesAlleviates buildup of sleep Light-purple boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates buildup of sleep. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of FP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
940Preserving BolusesAlleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot Scarlet boluses made of cave moss. Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot aliment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Scarlet rot accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Scarlet rot ailment greatly lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
950Rejuvenating BolusesAlleviates death blight buildup Black boluses made of cave moss. Alleviates death blight buildup. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Blight accumulates slowly, causing instant death once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
960Clarifying BolusesAlleviates madness buildup Yellow boluses made of cave moss. Alleviates madness buildup. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Madness accumulates slowly, inflicting heavy damage and reducing FP once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
1000Flask of Crimson TearsRestores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

It will replenish itself after a period of time, but touching a Site of Grace will restore it immediately.

1067Flask of Cerulean Tears +8Restores FP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

1110Immunizing Cured MeatTemporarily boosts immunity Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity. Higher immunity helps to mitigate the buildup of various poisons and scarlet rot.
1120Invigorating Cured MeatTemporarily boosts robustness Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts robustness. Higher robustness helps to mitigate the buildup of frost and blood loss.

1220Deathsbane JerkyBoost instant death resistance for a short time A grey colored cured liver, dried out after pickling in a medicinal solution. Craftable item. Boosts instant death resistance for a short time.
1235Raw Meat DumplingRestores HP but also poisons the user A pungent raw meatball, made succulent by virtue of being on the verge of turning. Restores HP but also poisons the user. Not recommended for those who prefer to know the origin of their meats.
1240Shabriri GrapeYellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape. Give to the blind maiden to guide her to the distant light.
1290Starlight ShardsRestores FP An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight. Restores FP. A prized item that was once used in the Eternal City as an ingredient in intoxicating draughts.

1700Throwing DaggerThrow at enemies to inflict damage Short dagger for throwing. It has no handguard. The blade is polished, and its weight is expertly balanced. Throw at enemies to deal damage. This auxiliary weapon, used primarily to constrain an enemy's movements, can still be deadly in the right hands.
1710Bone DartThrow at enemies to inflict damage Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing. Craftable item. Throw at enemies to inflict damage.
1720Poisonbone DartThrow at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing, with a poison-laced tip. Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison.
1730KukriThrow at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss A large knife used for throwing. Its curved blade is sharp enough to slice flesh cleanly. Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss. This heavy throwing weapon is unsuitable for swift attacks, but is able to inflict heavy damage.
1740Crystal DartThrow at enemies to inflict magic damage Throwing knife chiseled from impure crystal. Throw at enemies to deal magic damage. Long ago, it is said that a golem crafter employed a similar crystal tool.
1750Fan DaggersThrow fanned-out knives at enemies to inflict damage A set of five throwing knives bundled together. A concealed weapon cherished by the raptor assassins. The thin knives fan out when thrown, dealing damage to the target. Each knife deals paltry damage, but the wide range makes it suitable for constraining enemies.
1760Ruin FragmentFound near the remains of fallen ruins Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies. These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky. They glow with a faint light from within.
1810Fetid FleshUtterly entrances wild beasts A lump of beast flesh pickled in egg wash. Craftable item. Beasts are highly attracted to its scent. The rancid scent prevents ingestion by any ordinary human.
1830Explosive StoneExplodes when thrown, inflicting fire damage A small stone with a smoldering core. Explodes when thrown at enemies, inflicting fire damage. Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
1831Explosive Stone ClumpExplodes when thrown together, inflicting fire damage A clump of small stones with smoldering cores. Explodes when thrown together at enemies, inflicting fire damage. Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
1840Poisoned StoneThrow at enemies to cause buildup of poison A small stone with a poison core. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison. Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
1841Poisoned Stone ClumpThrow together to cause buildup of poison A clump of small stones with poison cores. Throw together at enemies to cause buildup of poison. Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
2020Rainbow StoneShines with colored light when placed, serving as a guide Ruin Fragment that has undergone some simple processing. Craftable item. Stones such as these shine with the colors of the rainbow, making them useful markers when placed on the ground. Can also be dropped to gauge the distance of a fall. The higher the pitch of the sound, the higher the likelihood of the fall being fatal. Once used to entertain children on the fringes of the Lands Between.
2030GlowstoneEmits a faint light from the location it is placed Polished Ruin Fragment that shines brighter than Rainbow Stone. Craftable item. Emits light from the location it is placed, illuminating surroundings. However, the effect is short-lived, and it lacks the diverse colors of rainbow stones. May serve some benefit in dark places, or at night.
2040TelescopeAllows viewer to see faraway things Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family. A stolen part of a larger instrument. Allows the viewer to better see faraway things. During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine. The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.
2050Grace MimicLight shows the path, but without order A fetish indicating the guidance of grace. Craftable item. Similar to grace, this fetish draws rays guiding the way, only without any sense of order. Useful as a last resort for those who have lost their way, or for use by those who believe that unrefined guidance will lead to truer encounters.
2070LanternAttach to waist to illuminate surroundings A small waist-worn lantern that illuminates surroundings. Use once to turn on, and again to turn off. While its light is dimmer than that of a torch, it has the advantage of freeing up the user's hands.
2080Blasphemous ClawDeflects the power of the Black Blade A slab of rock engraved with traces of the Rune of Death. Can deflect the power of the Black Blade. On the night of the dire plot, Ranni rewarded Praetor Rykard with these traces. Should the coming trespass one day transpire, they would serve as a last-resort foil, allowing Rykard to challenge Maliketh the Black Blade, the black beast of Destined Death.
2090DeathrootBeast Clergyman seeks and devours these A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death. The Beast Clergyman, found at Bestial Sanctum in the distant east, collects and devours these roots. On the night of the dire plot the stolen Rune of Death enabled the first Death of a demigod. Later, the Rune of Death spread across the Lands Between through the underground roots of the Greattree, sprouting in the form of Deathroot.
2100Soft CottonTemporarily reduces fall damage/sound and sound of footsteps A soft but sturdy cotton formed from splitting open Rowa fruit in a particular manner. Craftable item. Attaching this cotton to the bottom of one's feet allows for a temporary reduction in fall damage and sound. It also reduces the sound of one's footsteps. If you must court danger, at the very least, tread lightly.
2120SoapRemoves filth and accumulations on the body A plant-based soap made from mushroom juice. Craftable item. Cleans off filth and other accumulations on the body while also slightly reducing poison buildup. Filth covering the exterior eventually seeps inside, soiling one's very spirit.
2130Celestial DewCarry out Absolution at the Church of Vows A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear. Allows one to carry out an Absolution at the Church of Vows, reversing all antagonizations. Once upon a time, the stars of the night sky guided fate, and this is a recollection of those times.

Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of powerâ€”enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.

Use to be granted audience with Mohg. Only, it is not yet time. For Mohg yet slumbers beside the Divinity. Be patient. The new dynasty is nigh.
2190Miquella's NeedleSubdues a once-accepted frenzied flame One of the unalloyed gold needles that Miquella crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods. Capable of subduing the flame of frenzy if inherited, allowing one to cheat fate and avoid becoming Lord of Frenzied Flame. However, the needle is as yet unfinished and can only be used in the heart of the storm beyond time said to be found in Faram Azula.

2919Lord's RuneUse to gain an enormous abundance of runes Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; true vestiges of gold. Use to gain 50000 runes. Runes of one who was destined to become a Lord, but when the Elden Ring was shattered, all that remained was a distant duty.
2950Remembrance of the GraftedTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Godrick, the Grafted, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. A feeble man sought power through the grotesque act of grafting. "One day we'll return together, to our home, bathed in rays of gold."
2951Remembrance of the StarscourgeTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Starscourge Radahn, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. The Red Lion General wielded gravitational powers which he learned in Sellia during his younger days. All so he would never have to abandon his beloved but scrawny steed.
2952Remembrance of the Omen KingTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Morgott, the Omen King, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Though born one of the graceless Omen, Morgott took it upon himself to become the Erdtree's protector. He loved not in return, for he was never loved, but nevertheless, love it he did.
2953Remembrance of the BlasphemousTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Rykard took the form of a giant serpent that he might devour, grow, and live eternally. "I understand. The road of blasphemy is long and perilous. One cannot walk it unprepared to sin."
2954Remembrance of the Rot GoddessTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Malenia, Goddess of Rot, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Miquella and Malenia are both the children of a single god. As such they are both Empyreans, but suffered afflictions from birth. One was cursed with eternal childhood, and the other harbored rot within.
2955Remembrance of the Blood LordTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Mohg, Lord of Blood, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Wishing to raise Miquella to full godhood, Mohg wished to become his consort, taking the role of monarch. But no matter how much of his bloody bedchamber he tried to share, he received no response from the young Empyrean.
2956Remembrance of the Black BladeTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Maliketh was a shadowbound beast given to his Empyrean. Marika's sole need of her shadow was a vessel to lock away Destined Death. Even then, she betrayed him.
2957Remembrance of Hoarah LouxTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of the warrior Hoarah Loux, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. When Godfrey, first Elden Lord was robbed of his grace, becoming Tarnished, he took with him his kinfolk and left the Lands Between. After the Long March of the Tarnished came to an end, Godfrey divested himself of kingship, becoming a simple warrior once more.
2958Remembrance of the DragonlordTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. The Dragonlord whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time is said to have been Elden Lord in the age before the Erdtree. Once his god was fled, the lord continued to await its return.
2959Remembrance of the Full Moon QueenTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. In her youth, Rennala was a prominent champion who charmed the academy with her lunar magic, becoming its master. She also led the Glintstone Knights and established the house of Caria as royalty.
2960Remembrance of the LichdragonTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Lichdragon Fortissax, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. After Godwyn the Golden became the Prince of Death, the ancient dragon fought long and hard against the Death within its companion. Alas, victory was never achieved and its only reward was corruption.
2961Remembrance of the Fire GiantTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Fire Giant, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. The Fire Giant is a survivor of the War against the Giants. Upon realizing the flames of their forge would never die, Queen Marika marked him with a curse. "O trifling giant, mayest thou tend thy flame for eternity."
2962Remembrance of the Regal AncestorTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor Spirit, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Ancestral spirits exist as a phenomenon beyond the purview of the Erdtree. Life sprouts from death, as it does from birth. Such is the way of the living.
2963Elden RemembranceTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of the Elden Beast, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. It was the vassal beast of the Greater Will and living incarnation of the concept of Order.
2964Remembrance of the NaturalbornTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. A malformed star born in the lightless void far away. Once destroyed an Eternal City and took away their sky. A falling star of ill omen.
2990Lands Between RuneUse to gain many runes Grace said to have once dwelled in the eyes of the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold. Use to gain 3000 runes. No grace resides in the eyes of the Tarnished; if it ever did, it is now lost.
3000Ancestral Infant's HeadUses FP to spray spirit vapor Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear. Uses FP to spray spirit vapor, inflicting magic damage. The vapor becomes a temporary geyser which deals continuous damage to everything it touches until it disappears.
3010Omen BairnUses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes Doll of a curseborn bairn. Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies have all their horns excised, causing most to perish. These fetishes are made to memorialize them. "Please, don't hate me, or curse me. Please."
3011Regal Omen BairnUses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line. Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies born of royalty do not have their horns excised, but instead are kept underground, unbeknownst to anyone, imprisoned for eternity. These memorial fetishes are fashioned in secret.
3020Miranda's PrayerUses FP to call down a deluge of light This statuette depicts a flower that preys on humans, posed in prayer. Uses FP to call down a deluge of light. Miranda, maiden of the Flower Crucible is said to have been the very first of this breed.
3030Cuckoo GlintstoneThrow to produce magic bolts on impact Lump of broken glintstone enwreathed with magic power. A "faux sorcery" used by the Knights of the Cuckoo. Launched straight ahead. Magic bolts spring forth from the point of impact.
3040Mimic's VeilUses FP to mimic nearby objects Golden veil of intricate design. Uses FP to mimic nearby objects. When Godrick was hounded from Leyndell, the Royal Capital, this was one of a multitude of treasures he took with him. Also known as "Marika's Mischief."
3050Glintstone ScrapCrush gem to produce magic bolts Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Crush gem to produce magic bolts. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
3051Large Glintstone ScrapCrush gem to produce many magic bolts Large piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Crush gem to produce magic bolts. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
3060Gravity Stone FanThrow near foes to make fan-shaped gravitational shockwave Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Throw near foes to make fan-shaped gravitational shockwave. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."
3070Gravity Stone ChunkThrow at foe to cause a gravitational explosion Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Throw at enemies to cause a gravitational explosion. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."
3080Wraith Calling BellUses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths Bell used by worshippers of revenants. Ring bell, using FP to summon prowling wraiths. This can be done multiple times in a row. Wraiths are said to be the vengeful spirits of those who died when cursed.
3300Holy Water GreaseConsumes FP, allowing weapon to purify undead foes Grease which holds the blessing of the Erdtree. Craftable item. Consumes FP when coated on weapon, allowing it to deal magical damage and purify those who have lived beyond death. There is no place in the Golden Order for those who have exceeded life's bounds. These blemishes must be hunted down by the Virtuous.
3310Warming StoneContinuously heal nearby allies Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers. Generates warmth where activated, continuously restoring the HP of nearby allies. It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.
3311Frenzyflame StoneUses FP to continuously heal chaos followers Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Three Fingers. Craftable item. Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those who host the frenzied flame. Confers madness upon those who have not adopted the flame. Take care not to mistake this for its gentler cousin.
3320ScriptstoneReveals more messages from other worlds Ruin Fragment with a cipher inscription. Craftable item. Uses FP to reveal more messages from other worlds. Words are gregarious things, drawn to one another much as people are.
3350Bewitching BranchMist briefly makes allies of foes Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold. Thrust branch forward to release a beguiling mist, entrancing foes such that they temporarily join your cause. The Empyrean Miquella is loved by many people. Indeed, he has learned very well how to compel such affection.
3360Baldachin's BlessingUses FP to temporarily boost poise Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. Uses FP to temporarily boost poise. The favor allows one to forget any aches and pains. In Death, there is only peace, for in Death, there can be no sensation.
3361Radiant Baldachin's BlessingUses FP to temporarily boost poise Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity. Uses FP to temporarily raise poise. The effect lasts longer than a mere favor. It is said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.
3500Uplifting AromaticBoosts attack power and reduces incoming damage once Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering. Raises the attack power of the user and nearby allies while also reducing the damage from one incoming attack by half. This aromatic has an extremely potent morale-raising effect that makes those accustomed to it fearless in the face of death. It was this influence that made the perfumers exceptional commanders.
3510Spark AromaticBroadly scatter sparks in a wide area Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering. Broadly scatters sparks in a wide arc straight ahead. Though fire was prohibited to those who served the Erdtree, this rule was forgotten as the war drew ever on.
3520Ironjar AromaticRaises defenses but lowers mobility Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Temporarily turns body to steel, boosting poise, resistances and damage negation at the expense of mobility and lightning resistance. An art that requires fragments of hunted noble jars. Depraved perfumers are plainly in league with jar poachers.
3550Bloodboil AromaticRaises attack but also damage received Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Induces a temporary state of fervor, raising maximum attack power and stamina while also increasing damage received. "Even upon the battlefield, do you fear being wounded? Take a good look. Your limbs are frozen stiff."
3580Poison SpraymistReleases a poison mist that travels forwards Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Releases a poison mist from user's mouth that travels forwards, causing a buildup of poison. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.
3610Acid SpraymistReleases acidic mist and lowers attack Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Releases an acidic mist from user's mouth that travels forwards, damaging armaments and temporarily lowering attack power. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.
8000Stonesword KeyUse to break one imp statue seal but lost upon use A sword-shaped stone key. Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.
8005Cord EndGain entry somewhere A carefully woven cord. This cord belonged to the young girls who were housed in a place that was meant as an eternal secret. The cutting-gifted tribe vowed to sacrifice their flesh while concealing the truth. But the girls were too young to oblige.
8102Lucent Baldachin's BlessingRaise in prayer to gain protection Sacred seal of a hidden shrine that looks much like a bedchamber. A faint light leaks through a crack in its fastened doors, as if the Firefly is beckoning to come inside. Raise in prayer to gain protection. Gaining protection consumes this item, but can grant unique effects. Take care though, these effects cannot be undone.
8105Dectus Medallion (Left)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia. The right half is said to reside in Fort Faroth in the Dragonbarrow, far to the east.
8106Dectus Medallion (Right)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia. The left half is said to reside in the coastal Fort Haight to the far west.
8107Rold MedallionOperates Grand Lift of Rold Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak. Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants. The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.
8109Academy Glintstone KeyKey to open the academy's two sealed gates Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Activates warp magic bound within the seals. A glintstone key will remember its user, meaning once used it can never be passed on to another. The academy does not welcome the indolent.
8111Carian Inverted StatueKey revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted. Reveals the hidden form of the Carian Study Hall, which connects to the divine tower. To unveil the secret, affix it to the pedestal of the celestial globe.
8121Dark Moon RingRing of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort. Ranni is an Empyrean, meaning her consort would by rights earn the title of lord. A warning is engraved within; "Whoever thou mayest be, take not the ring from this place, the solitude beyond the night is better mine alone."
8126Fingerprint GrapeEyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow. Seared with a repulsive fingerprint burn akin to those that marred his entire body. If offered to the blind maiden, it will lead her to the source of the distant light, allowing her to become a Finger Maiden.
8127Letter from Volcano ManorRequest from Volcano Manor Examine using A written request from Volcano Manor disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted. "Old Knight Istvan" He can be found in Limgrave. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.
8128Tonic of ForgetfulnessTonic that banishes distress and bitter memories Tonic in a small brass vial. Banishes distress and bitter memories. A gift bestowed by Rykard, sworn to blasphemy, to Lady Tanith, who unfortunately had no use for it. "My Lord, there could be no greater distress than to forget you."
8129Serpent's AmnionAmnion from a womb that bore unintended offspring Amnion from the mother's womb which cradled the poor unwanted offspring of a repellant birthing ritual. It will never dry out, remaining damp indefinitely.
8130Rya's NecklaceNecklace worn everywhere by Irina A necklace worn and treasured by Irina. Given to her as a farewell gift.
8131Irina's LetterLetter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne. Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within.
8132Letter from Volcano ManorRequest from Volcano Manor Examine using A written request from Volcano Manor disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted. "Rileigh the Idle" He can be found in Altus Plateau. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

"Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood" He can be found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

8136Rya's NecklaceRya's necklace, stolen by a blackguard Necklace stolen from Rya by the blackguard. Features a relief of a dignified looking woman from a foreign country. It appears to hold great significance for Rya.
8137Volcano Manor InvitationLetter of invitation to Volcano Manor Letter given by Rya as thanks for retrieving her necklace. Contains an invitation to Volcano Manor. "Brave Tarnished, Seek the Altus Plateau in the realm of the Erdtree. Prove yourself by making this journey, and the Volcano Manor will fully extend its invitation. To fight, amongst a family of champions."
8142Amber StarlightIngredient used in special draught An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight. If the stars command our fates, then amber-hued stars must command the fates of the gods. Such is the belief that inspired the use of these shards to prepare a most special draught. Cannot be consumed by mere humans.
8143Seluvis's IntroductionLetter of introduction addressed to Sellen Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms. A letter of introduction written by Preceptor Seluvis. Addressed to a glintstone sorceress by the name of Sellen. The contents of the scroll cannot be discerned.
8144Sellen's Primal GlintstoneGlintstone from within Sellen's body Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body. Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within. In essence, a primal glintstone is a sorcerer's soul. If transplanted into a compatible new body after their original body dies, the sorcerer will rise again. "My apprentice, do you think it distasteful?"
8146Miniature RanniDoll resembling Ranni the Witch A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect. This unresponsive doll seems pleasantly cool.
8147Asimi, Silver TearAsimi that has infected a tarnished An asimi that has infected a tarnished. An intelligent silver sludge; asimi infect the body of tarnished, granting the host power.

8155Lord of Blood's FavorBloodied white oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood. The final trial is complete. Luminary Mohg is sure to welcome you into his service, as a knight who will lay the foundations for his dynasty.

8158Spirit Calling BellBell that summons various spirits from ashen items A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use. Spirits can only be summoned in the vicinity of a rebirth monument. When summoning is possible, the monument icon will be visible on the left side of the screen. Only one type of spirit may be summoned at once, and none may be summoned during multiplayer.
8159Fingerslayer BladeHidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse. This blood-drenched fetish is proof of the high treason committed by the Eternal City and symbolizes its downfall. Cannot be wielded by those without a fate, but is said to be able to harm the Greater Will and its vassals.

8162Gold Sewing NeedleSpecial sewing needle for demigod attire Sewing needle made of gold. Unique item made to alter demigod attire. One of the tools brought by Radagon when he entered into marriage with Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, and joined the Carian line.
8163Tailoring ToolsEnables armor adjustment at sites of grace A portable set of tailoring tools. Enables armor alterations at sites of grace.

Sellia, Town of Sorcery can be found in Caelid. This key was said to have been found in the possession of a Sellian sorcerer.
8171Chrysalids' MementoBroach wrapped in red velvet Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible. Faintly visible spirits try to convey something, but their voices cannot be heard.
8172Black KnifeprintMark of the Night of the Black Knives ritual On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers. This mark is evidence of the ritual, and hides the truth of the conspiracy.

"Vargram the Raging Wolf" "Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm" Both men can be found in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.
8174Academy Glintstone KeyKey to open the academy's two sealed gates Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Activates warp magic bound within the seals. This glintstone key is still brand new, unused by anyone.
8175Haligtree Secret Medallion (Left)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
8176Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
8181Burial Crow's LetterLetter written about the caravans A letter written about the caravans. It seems to have been sent from the capital underground.
8182Mending Rune of Perfect OrderCan be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord. A rune of transcendental ideology which will attempt to perfect the Golden Order. The current imperfection of the Golden Order, or instability of ideology, can be blamed upon the fickleness of the gods no better than men. That is the fly in the ointment.
8183Mending Rune of the Death-PrinceCan be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord. Formed of the two hallowbrand half-wheels combined, it will embed the principle of life within Death into Order. The Golden Order was created by confining Destined Death. Thus, this new Order will be one of Death restored.
8184Mending Rune of the Fell CurseCan be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord. The reviled curse will last eternally, and the world's children, grandchildren, and every generation hence, will be its pustules. If Order is defiled entirely, defilement is defilement no more, and for every curse, a cursed blessing.
8185Larval TearMaterial needed by Rennala to grant rebirth Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear. As much a substance as it is a living organism. Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew. Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up.
8186Imbued Sword KeyUnseals sending gate, but disappears upon use Stone key shaped like a sword. A special item, imbued with rich blue magic. Breaks the seal on the imp statues guarding the sending gates enshrined in each belfry, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.
8187Miniature RanniDoll resembling Ranni the Witch A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect. The chilliness is gone, feeling now like an empty husk. There is no response.
8188Golden Tailoring ToolsAllows demigod garb alteration at sites of grace Tailoring tools made from gold. Tools brought with the red-haired Radagon when he married into the Carian line. With these, even demigod attire can be altered at a site of grace.
8189Iji's ConfessionLetter of confession found on Iji's corpse A letter of confession found on Iji's corpse. He declares his own guilt for having sealed away Blaidd.
8190Knifeprint ClueSimple map showing location of black knifeprint Examine using A simple map given by Fia. A clue to the whereabouts of a black knifeprint.
8191Cursemark of DeathCursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede. This cursemark was carved at the moment of Death of the first demigod, and should have taken the shape of a circle. However, two demigods perished at the same time, breaking the cursemark into two half-wheels. Ranni was the first of the demigods whose flesh perished, while the Prince of Death perished in soul alone.
8192Asimi's HuskThe shedding of an Asimi that infected a tarnished The shedding of an Asimi that infected a tarnished.
8193Seedbed CurseCurse grown on a body defiled by the Dung Eater Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns. The Dung Eater cultivates the seedbed curse on corpses. By doing so he prevents dead souls returning to the Erdtree, leaving them forever cursed. One of the most loathsome things found in all the Lands Between.
8194The Stormhawk KingAshes of a hawk which heeds no summons Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other. This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.
8195Asimi, Silver ChrysalidAn Asimi that infected a tarnished An Asimi that infected a tarnished.
8196Unalloyed Gold NeedleIntricate needle of unalloyed gold An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew. "There is something I must return to Malenia. The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot."
8197Sewer-Gaol KeyUnlocks sewer-gaol door beneath Leyndell Filthy key received from the Dung Eater. Unlocks sewer-gaol door said to lie beneath Leyndell, the Royal Capital.
8198Meeting Place MapSimple map showing a meeting place Examine using Simple map found on a corpse. Seems to point to a meeting place. The man it came from surely desired one. The sole means of gaining entry into the academy: a glintstone key.
8199Discarded Palace KeyKey to treasure chest for Carian Princesses A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh. Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses. It is said to be found in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria with her mother Rennala.
8200"Homing Instinct" PaintingReminiscence of the painting "Homing Instinct" Examine using Work of a wandering artist. Reminiscence of a painting titled "Homing Instinct." This painter is said to have captured the landscapes seen during the last moments of those welcomed into death's embrace. The soul of the painter, and vestiges of the dead's last moments can be discovered by visiting the location depicted even now.

So that one day, I can carry on Mother's work. Be the proud daughter of Tanith of Volcano Manor. Farewell. You've always been so kind. So uncompromising. My champion."
8222Alexander's InnardsKeepsake of the warrior jar Alexander A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander. Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar. The jars contain dregs inherited from those who came before. Thus are warriors passed from jar to jar, carrying dreams of greatness.

I heard he lies in a deep sleep in the aqueduct beside the Eternal City of Nokron. And it's said he stood before the Prince of Death not far beyond that spot."
